definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Then he wanted to escape from there but tripped over a coil of rope.
sentences.chinese: 然后他想逃离那里但被一卷绳索绊倒了。

sentences.english: You and your fantasy danced and laughed and never stumbled.
sentences.chinese: 你和你的幻想欢乐地跳舞，从没有被绊倒过。

sentences.english: She tripped over a cordless phone.
sentences.chinese: 她被无线电话的线给绊倒在地。

sentences.english: He always appeared to be stumbling over his shoestrings .
sentences.chinese: 好像他总会被自己的鞋带绊倒。

sentences.english: Your mum's so stupid she tripped over a cordless phone.
sentences.chinese: 你妈妈这么笨，她的脚肯定被无绳电话绊倒过。

sentences.english: Be carefull! Don't stumble over these stones.
sentences.chinese: 小心，别让这些碎石绊倒了。

sentences.english: The stumbling blocks are just stepping stones to success.
sentences.chinese: 绊倒你的石头正是成功路上的塌脚石。

sentences.english: I gripped the striped strip that tripped x me over on the ship.
sentences.chinese: 我握着那条在船上将我绊倒的带条纹的带子。

sentences.english: Be careful you don't trip (up) on the mat.
sentences.chinese: 小心别在地席上绊倒了。

sentences.english: Her sisters tripped over her legs when they stumbled out of the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 姊姊们从浴室里跌跌撞撞地跑出来，总被她的腿绊倒。

sentences.english: The pessimist stumbles over pebbles even on a wide and well-paved road.
sentences.chinese: 悲观的人，即使走在平坦的大道，也会被小石子绊倒。

sentences.english: There are boulders to stumble on.
I suppose I tripped on a red sequin on the ice.
sentences.chinese: 我猜测我被冰面上的一小块红色装饰片绊倒了。

definition: to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to tumble/to fall/fig. to suffer a reverse (in politics or business)
to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
to fall flat on one's face
